prompt: Facts: Petition filed under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) seeking quashing of the entire criminal proceedings, including the FIR (Pakur (Town) P.S. Case No. 114 of 2011) and the order taking cognizance dated 21.02.2012.; The FIR was registered under Sections 498A, 323, 504 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Sections 3/4 of the Dowry Prohibition Act.; The petitioners are Shobha Devi (mother-in-law), Binod Kumar Singh (husband), Binay Kumar Singh (brother-in-law), Usha Devi (sister-in-law), and Pradeep Kumar Singh (brother-in-law) of the complainant/Opposite Party No. 2.; The complainant alleged that after her marriage to Binod Kumar Singh on 27.01.2010, she was subjected to torture and cruelty by all the petitioners due to non-fulfillment of dowry demands (including a motorcycle and cash).; Specific allegations include assault, mental harassment, and demands for dowry made soon after the marriage and continuing thereafter.; The police investigated the matter and submitted a charge-sheet against the petitioners.; The Chief Judicial Magistrate, Pakur, took cognizance of the offences under Sections 498A, 323, 504 IPC and Sections 3/4 of the Dowry Prohibition Act via order dated 21.02.2012.; The petitioners argued that the allegations are general, omnibus, and lack specific details regarding the time, date, and nature of involvement of each petitioner, especially the distant relatives (petitioners 3, 4, 5).; Petitioners contended that the case was filed maliciously due to matrimonial discord and is an abuse of the process of law. | IPC: Section 498A, Section 323, Section 504
